p: Violante et al. (2012) reported the antibacterial activity of an ethyl acetate fraction of Hyptis crenata against Enterococcus faecalis (MIC 31.3 μg/mL) and a dichloromethane fraction against Staphylococcus aureus (MIC 62.5 μg/mL) and Enterococcus faecalis (MIC 62.5 μg/mL). On the other hand, the ethanolic extract of Mesosphaerum sidifolium (syn. Hyptis sidifolia (L'Hér.) Briq.) was investigated against Staphylococcus aureus showing low antibacterial activity (MIC 1000 μg/mL) ( Bussmann et al., 2010).
